meanings.definition: Coming or going into a place
meanings.sent1: The inbound train arrived at the station on time.
meanings.sent2: The inbound flight from New York landed safely at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The inbound bus was so full that no more passengers could squeeze in.
meanings.sent4: The inbound traffic jam stretched for miles, causing delays for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The inbound students eagerly entered the school for their first day of classes.

meanings.sent1: The inbound package was delivered to the doorstep in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The inbound guests were warmly welcomed at the party.
meanings.sent3: The inbound cat snuck into the house through the open window.
meanings.sent4: The inbound tide brought in a variety of seashells onto the shore.
meanings.sent5: The inbound rain shower caught everyone by surprise during the picnic.

meanings.sent1: The inbound storm clouds signaled an approaching thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: The inbound phone call was from a long-lost friend.
meanings.sent3: The inbound flock of birds flew overhead in a mesmerizing formation.
meanings.sent4: The inbound smell of freshly baked cookies wafted through the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The inbound spaceship slowly descended towards the landing pad.
